qas.question: What is a prominent example of a movement which crosses over denominational lines?
Which movement actually affected the Catholic Church?
What groups beliefs does the Charismatic Movement seek to add to branches of Christianity?
Name a sub-group of the Charismatic Movement.
What other types of churches often adopt charismatic or evangelical beliefs?

context: There are also Christian movements which cross denominational lines and even branches, and cannot be classified on the same level previously mentioned forms. <a0_0>Evangelicalism<a0_0/> is a prominent example. Some of those movements are active exclusively within Protestantism, some are Christian-wide. Transdenominational movements are sometimes capable of affecting parts of the Roman Catholic Church, such as does it the <a1_0>Charismatic Movement<a1_0/>, which aims to incorporate beliefs and practices similar to <a2_0>Pentecostals<a2_0/> into the various branches of Christianity. <a3_0>Neo-charismatic churches<a3_0/> are sometimes regarded as a subgroup of the Charismatic Movement. <a4_0>Nondenominational churches<a4_0/> often adopt, or are akin to one of these movements.
